noun.description: An ornamental border of threads left loose or formed into tassels or twists, used to edge clothing or material.
The front part of a person's hair cut so as to hang over the forehead; bangs.
The outer, marginal, or extreme part of an area, group, or sphere of activity.
examples: his uncles were on the fringes of crooked activity

noun.description: A band of contrasting brightness or darkness produced by diffraction or interference of light.

adjective.description: Not part of the mainstream; unconventional, peripheral, or extreme.

verb.description: Decorate (clothing or material) with a fringe.
examples: a rich robe of gold, fringed with black velvet

origin: Middle English: from Old French frenge, based on late Latin fimbria, earlier a plural noun meaning fibers, shreds.
